# MSMessagesAppPresentationContext.media

**Case**

A constant that indicates the iMessage app appears inside the Stickers app throughout iOS including in Messages, FaceTime, the emoji keyboard, and Markup.

## Declaration

```swift
case media
```

## Discussion

The media context supports only a subset of the Messages framework API. Specifically, the following limits apply:

- The iMessage app can only insert sticker and image attachments. You can’t insert [doc://com.apple.messages/documentation/Messages/MSMessage] objects, text, or non-image assets.
- You can’t use any of the [doc://com.apple.messages/documentation/Messages/MSConversation] class’s `send` messages ([doc://com.apple.messages/documentation/Messages/MSConversation/sendAttachment(_:withAlternateFilename:completionHandler:)], [doc://com.apple.messages/documentation/Messages/MSConversation/send(_:completionHandler:)-9krz], [doc://com.apple.messages/documentation/Messages/MSConversation/send(_:completionHandler:)-4kje0], or [doc://com.apple.messages/documentation/Messages/MSConversation/sendText(_:completionHandler:)]).
- You can’t display a camera inside an [doc://com.apple.messages/documentation/Messages/MSMessagesAppPresentationContext/media] context.

## Presentation Contexts

- **MSMessagesAppPresentationContext.messages**: A constant that indicates the iMessage app appears in Messages in the list of iMessage apps that appears when you press the plus button.
